verses.verse: Now it happened in the fourteenth <S%H702><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> of king <S%H4428><s%> Hezekiah, <S%H2396><s%> that Sennacherib <S%H5576><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria <S%H804><s%> attacked <S%H5927><s%> all of the fortified <S%H1219><s%> cities <S%H5892><s%> of Judah, <S%H3063><s%> and captured them. <S%H8610><s%>

The king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria <S%H804><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%> Rabshakeh <S%H7262><s%> from Lachish <S%H3923><s%> to Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> to king <S%H4428><s%> Hezekiah <S%H2396><s%> with a large <S%H3515><s%> army. <S%H2426><s%> He stood <S%H5975><s%> by the aqueduct <S%H8585><s%> from the upper <S%H5945><s%> pool <S%H1295><s%> in the fuller <S%H3526><s%>'s field <S%H7704><s%> highway. <S%H4546><s%>

Then Eliakim <S%H471><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Hilkiah, <S%H2518><s%> who was over the household, <S%H1004><s%> and Shebna <S%H7644><s%> the scribe, <S%H5608><s%> and Joah, <S%H3098><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Asaph, <S%H623><s%> the recorder <S%H2142><s%> came out to him. <S%H3318><s%>

Rabshakeh <S%H7262><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to them, <S%H559><s%> "Now tell Hezekiah, <S%H2396><s%> <S%H559><s%> 'Thus says the great <S%H1419><s%> king, <S%H4428><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria, <S%H804><s%> "What confidence <S%H986><s%> is this in which you trust? <S%H986><s%>

I say <S%H559><s%> that your counsel <S%H6098><s%> and strength <S%H1369><s%> for the war <S%H4421><s%> are only vain <S%H8193><s%> words. <S%H1697><s%> Now in whom do you trust, <S%H982><s%> that you have rebelled against me? <S%H4775><s%>

Behold, <S%H982><s%> you trust in the staff <S%H4938><s%> of this bruised <S%H7533><s%> reed, <S%H7070><s%> even in Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> which if a man <S%H376><s%> leans <S%H5564><s%> on it, <S%H935><s%> it will go into his hand <S%H3709><s%> and pierce <S%H5344><s%> it. <S%H6547><s%> So is Pharaoh king <S%H4428><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> to all who trust in him. <S%H982><s%>

But if you tell <S%H559><s%> me, <S%H982><s%> 'We trust in Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> our God, <S%H430><s%>' isn't <S%H1116><s%> that he whose high places and whose altars <S%H4196><s%> Hezekiah <S%H2396><s%> has taken away, <S%H5493><s%> and has said <S%H559><s%> to Judah <S%H3063><s%> and to Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> <S%H7812><s%> 'You shall worship before <S%H6440><s%> this altar? <S%H4196><s%>'"

Now therefore, <S%H6148><s%> please make a pledge to my master <S%H113><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria, <S%H804><s%> and I will give <S%H5414><s%> you two thousand <S%H505><s%> horses, <S%H5483><s%> if you are able <S%H3201><s%> on your part to set <S%H5414><s%> riders on them. <S%H7392><s%>

How then can you turn away <S%H7725><s%> the face <S%H6440><s%> of one <S%H259><s%> captain <S%H6346><s%> of the least <S%H6996><s%> of my master <S%H113><s%>'s servants, <S%H5650><s%> and put your trust <S%H982><s%> on Egypt <S%H4714><s%> for chariots <S%H7393><s%> and for horsemen? <S%H6571><s%>

Have I come up <S%H5927><s%> now without <S%H1107><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> against this land <S%H776><s%> to destroy <S%H7843><s%> it? <S%H3068><s%> Yahweh said <S%H559><s%> to me, <S%H5927><s%> "Go up against this land, <S%H776><s%> and destroy it. <S%H7843><s%>"'"

Then Eliakim, <S%H471><s%> Shebna <S%H7644><s%> and Joah <S%H3098><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Rabshakeh, <S%H7262><s%> "Please speak <S%H1696><s%> to your servants <S%H5650><s%> in Aramaic, <S%H762><s%> for we understand <S%H8085><s%> it; <S%H1696><s%> and don't speak to us in the Jews <S%H3066><s%>' language in the hearing <S%H241><s%> of the people <S%H5971><s%> who are on the wall. <S%H2346><s%>"

But Rabshakeh <S%H7262><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Has my master <S%H113><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%> me only to your master <S%H113><s%> and to you, <S%H1696><s%> to speak these words, <S%H1697><s%> and not to the men <S%H582><s%> who sit <S%H3427><s%> on the wall, <S%H2346><s%> who will eat <S%H398><s%> their own dung <S%H2716><s%> and drink <S%H8354><s%> their own urine with you? <S%H7272><s%>"

Then Rabshakeh <S%H7262><s%> stood, <S%H5975><s%> and called <S%H7121><s%> out with a loud <S%H1419><s%> voice <S%H6963><s%> in the Jews <S%H3066><s%>' language, and said, <S%H559><s%> "Hear <S%H8085><s%> the words <S%H1697><s%> of the great <S%H1419><s%> king, <S%H4428><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria! <S%H804><s%>
Thus says <S%H559><s%> the king, <S%H4428><s%> <S%H2396><s%> 'Don't let Hezekiah deceive <S%H5377><s%> you; <S%H3201><s%> for he will not be able to deliver you. <S%H5337><s%>

Don't <S%H2396><s%> let Hezekiah make you trust <S%H982><s%> in Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> will surely <S%H5337><s%> deliver <S%H5337><s%> us. <S%H5892><s%> This city won't <S%H5414><s%> be given into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria. <S%H804><s%>"'

Don't <S%H8085><s%> listen to Hezekiah, <S%H2396><s%> for thus says <S%H559><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria, <S%H804><s%> <S%H6213><s%> 'Make your peace <S%H1293><s%> with me, <S%H3318><s%> and come out to me; <S%H376><s%> and each of you eat <S%H398><s%> from his vine, <S%H1612><s%> and each one <S%H376><s%> from his fig tree, <S%H8384><s%> and each one <S%H376><s%> of you drink <S%H8354><s%> the waters <S%H4325><s%> of his own cistern; <S%H953><s%>

until I come <S%H935><s%> and take you away <S%H3947><s%> to a land <S%H776><s%> like your own land, <S%H776><s%> a land <S%H776><s%> of grain <S%H1715><s%> and new wine, <S%H8492><s%> a land <S%H776><s%> of bread <S%H3899><s%> and vineyards. <S%H3754><s%>

Beware lest Hezekiah <S%H2396><s%> persuade <S%H5496><s%> you, <S%H559><s%> saying, "Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> will deliver <S%H5337><s%> us. <S%H376><s%>" Have any of the gods <S%H430><s%> of the nations <S%H1471><s%> delivered <S%H5337><s%> their lands <S%H776><s%> from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria? <S%H804><s%>

Where are the gods <S%H430><s%> of Hamath <S%H2574><s%> and Arpad? <S%H774><s%> Where are the gods <S%H430><s%> of Sepharvaim? <S%H5617><s%> Have they delivered <S%H5337><s%> Samaria <S%H8111><s%> from my hand? <S%H3027><s%>

Who are they among all the gods <S%H430><s%> of these countries <S%H776><s%> that have delivered <S%H5337><s%> their country <S%H776><s%> out of my hand, <S%H3027><s%> that Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> should deliver <S%H5337><s%> Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> out of my hand? <S%H3027><s%>'"

But they remained silent, <S%H2790><s%> and said <S%H6030><s%> nothing <S%H1697><s%> in reply, <S%H4428><s%> for the king's commandment <S%H4687><s%> was, <S%H559><s%> "Don't <S%H1697><s%> answer him."

Then Eliakim <S%H471><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Hilkiah, <S%H2518><s%> who was over the household, <S%H1004><s%> and Shebna <S%H7644><s%> the scribe, <S%H5608><s%> and Joah, <S%H3098><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Asaph, <S%H623><s%> the recorder, <S%H2142><s%> came <S%H935><s%> to Hezekiah <S%H2396><s%> with their clothes <S%H899><s%> torn, <S%H7167><s%> and told <S%H5046><s%> him the words <S%H1697><s%> of Rabshakeh. <S%H7262><s%>
